rice_details.description: Rice is a staple food for a large part of the world's human population, especially in Asia. It is the seed of the grass species Oryza sativa (Asian rice) or Oryza glaberrima (African rice).
rice_details.nutritional value: Rice is primarily a source of carbohydrates, providing energy for the body. It also contains small amounts of protein and various vitamins and minerals, depending on the variety and processing method.
rice_details.uses: Cooking (steamed rice, fried rice, risotto), Flour production (rice flour), Beverages (rice milk, rice wine)
rice_details.varieties: Long-grain rice, Medium-grain rice, Short-grain rice, Basmati rice, Jasmine rice
rice_details.harvest season: Rice is typically harvested in the fall, but the timing varies depending on the variety, location, and growing conditions.
rice_details.processing: Rice undergoes various processing methods, including milling, polishing, and parboiling, to produce different types of rice with distinct textures and flavors.

prerequisites.soil: Rice grows best in flooded or waterlogged soils such as clayey or loamy soil. The pH of the soil should be slightly acidic to neutral.
prerequisites.climate: Rice requires warm temperatures and high humidity for optimal growth. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates.
prerequisites.water: Rice cultivation often involves flooding or irrigation to keep the soil consistently moist. The water requirements vary depending on the growth stage.
prerequisites.space: Rice plants are typically spaced about 6 inches apart in rows spaced 9 inches apart. However, the spacing may vary depending on the variety and cultivation method.
